exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type B : Type f : A -> B -> A g : B -> A -> A h : A -> A a : A b : B H : h (f a b) = f (h a) b l' : list B IHl : fold_left f l' (h a) = h (fold_left f l' a) Unable to unify "h (fold_left f l' (f a b))" with "fold_left f l' (f (h a) b)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: Type
f: A -> B -> A
g: B -> A -> A
h: A -> A

Goal:
(forall (a : A) (b : B), h (f a b) = f (h a) b) -> forall (a : A) (l : list B), fold_left f l (h a) = h (fold_left f l a)

Premises:
fold_left : forall A B : Type, (A -> B -> A) -> list B -> A -> A
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
fold_left_eta : forall (l : list B) (a : A) (f1 : A -> B -> A), (forall (a0 : A) (b : B), In b l -> f a0 b = f1 a0 b) -> fold_left f l a = fold_left f1 l a
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
fold_left_rev_right : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> B) (l : list A) (i : B), fold_right f i (rev l) = fold_left (fun (x : B) (y : A) => f y x) l i
fold_left_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> A) (l l' : list B) (i : A), fold_left f (l ++ l') i = fold_left f l' (fold_left f l i)
fold_right_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> B) (l l' : list A) (i : B), fold_right f i (l ++ l') = fold_right f (fold_right f i l') l
fold_left_map : forall (C : Type) (a : A) (l : list C) (k : C -> B), fold_left f (map k l) a = fold_left (fun (a0 : A) (b : C) => f a0 (k b)) l a
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
partition_cons1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = true -> partition f (a :: l) = (a :: l1, l2)
partition_cons2 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (a : A) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> f a = false -> partition f (a :: l) = (l1, a :: l2)
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l
fold_symmetric : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> A -> A), (forall x y z : A, f x (f y z) = f (f x y) z) -> forall a0 : A, (forall y : A, f a0 y = f y a0) -> forall l : list A, fold_left f l a0 = fold_right f a0 l
count_occ_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (decA : forall x1 x2 : A, {x1 = x2} + {x1 <> x2}) (decB : forall y1 y2 : B, {y1 = y2} + {y1 <> y2}), (forall x1 x2 : A, f x1 = f x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (x : A) (l : list A), count_occ decA l x = count_occ decB (map f l) (f x)
fold_right : forall A B : Type, (B -> A -> A) -> A -> list B -> A
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {In a l} + {~ In a l}
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
NoDup_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
nodup_inv : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (k l : list A) (a : A), nodup decA k = a :: l -> ~ In a l
Field_theory.fcons_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (Fcons : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), (forall (l : list R) (a : Ring_polynom.PExpr C) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (Fcons a l1) -> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l...
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
Inductive NoDup (A : Type) : list A -> Prop := NoDup_nil : NoDup [] | NoDup_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l) Arguments NoDup [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments NoDup_nil _%type_scope Arguments NoDup_cons [A]%type_scope _ [l]%list_scope
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
NoDup_nth : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), NoDup l < -> (forall i j : nat, i < length l -> j < length l -> nth i l d = nth j l d -> i = j)
NoDup_cons_iff : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), NoDup (a :: l) < -> ~ In a l /\ NoDup l
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> [] -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ [a]}}
nth : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> A -> A
Field_theory.PFcons2_fcons_inv : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1
Field_theory.PFcons1_fcons_inv : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1
partition : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A * list A
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
last : forall A : Type, list A -> A -> A
rev_append : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> list A
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Field_theory.rinv_nz : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall a : R, ~ req a rO -> ~ req (rinv a) rO
list_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall l l' : list A, {l = l'} + {l <> l'}
NoDup_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l)
app_removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), l <> [] -> l = removelast l ++ [last l d]
rev : forall A : Type, list A -> list A

```coq
intros H a l.
induction l as [| b l' IHl].
- simpl. reflexivity.
- simpl. intros. rewrite IHl. specialize (H a b). rewrite H. reflexivity.
Qed.```
